questions.text: Which lymph nodes represent the primary echelon of drainage for the thyroid gland?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Central compartment nodes. The thyroid gland has a rich lymphatic supply and drains primarily to the central compartment or level VI nodes . These can be subdivided into pre-laryngeal (Delphian nodes), pretracheal and paratracheal regions.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: D. Although most thyroid lesions drain to these regions, occasionally drainage from the upper poles can be to the parapharyngeal part. Option: A & B. Papillary thyroid cancer (the most common malignancy of the thyroid) metastasizes often and early, so many nodes in central and lateral compartments of the neck may be involved. However, this is not always obvious on clinical examination or even imaging. Interestingly, even though micro-metastases are present in up to 40% of patients considered free of disease, micro-metastases rarely progress to cause clinical recurrence and therefore elective neck dissection is not routinely advocated.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions does not usually present with hyperthyroidism?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Thyroid malignancy. Thyroid cancer very rarely presents as hyperthyroidism.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Graves’ disease is a common autoimmune condition that usually occurs in young women and is associated with eye signs . Abnormal TSH receptor antibodies produce a disproportionate and prolonged effect. It can be associated with other autoimmune conditions such as Addison’s disease, type 1 diabetes, pernicious anemia, and coeliac disease. Option: B. Toxic nodular goiter is often seen in middle age or the elderly and is rarely associated with eye signs. A solitary toxic nodule is often autonomous, and its hypertrophy or hyperplasia is not associated with TSH receptor antibodies. Option: D. Thyroid inflammation, especially postpartum, can cause hyperthyroidism.

questions.text: What are the manifestations of thyrotoxicosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Thyrotoxicosis is characterized by the clinical, physiological, and biochemical changes resulting from tissue exposure to excess thyroid hormone. It can present symptoms of hyperactivity, insomnia, heat intolerance, weight loss, increased appetite, palpitations, and fatigue. The signs often are fine tremors, warm moist skin, proptosis palmar erythema, onycholysis, hair loss, high output heart failure, and, rarely, periodic paralysis associated with hypokalaemia.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Options: A, B & C. All three are seen in thyrotoxicosis.

questions.text: Which of the following are associated with Graves’ disease?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above The exophthalmos in thyroid eye disease is due to retrobulbar infiltration of tissue with fluid and round cells. Oedema of the eyelids and conjunctival injection might be worsened by compression of ophthalmic veins. Urgent action (orbital decompression) is necessary for corneal ulceration, congestive ophthalmopathy, or optic neuropathy. Treatment with steroids and orbital radiotherapy is sometimes necessary. Thyroid dermopathy is caused by deposition of hyaluronidase in the dermis and cutis.

Highyeild:

Grave's Disease is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism and is caused by autoantibodies that stimulate TSH-R . It is an autoimmune disease that has a strong familial predisposition . Females are more commonly affected, with the peak incidence occurring between 40-60 years of age. The disease is characterized by thyrotoxicosis, diffuse goiter, and extrathyroidal conditions such as ophthalmopathy, dermopathy, thyroid acropachy, gynecomastia, Proptosis and lid retraction - Graves’ disease

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Options: A, B & C. are all seen in Graves's disease.

Extraedge:

Graves' disease may have multiple triggers, including iodine excess, bacterial or viral infections, the post-partum state, and lithium therapy. The disease is associated with specific human leukocyte antigen (HLA) genes, including HLA-B8, HLA-DR3, HLA-DQA10501, and CTLA-4 . However, HLA-DRB10701 is protective against the development of Graves' disease.

questions.text: Which of the following are true regarding medical therapy for thyrotoxicosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Propranolol and nadolol reduce free T3 (fT3) and free T4 (fT4) levels.

options.label: B
options.text: Antithyroid drugs most often cure thyrotoxicosis due to a toxic nodule.

options.label: C
options.text: Carbimazole can be safely given during pregnancy and lactation.

options.label: D
options.text: Agranulocytosis is an uncommon problem with antithyroid drugs.

questions.correct_answer: C. Carbimazole can be safely given during pregnancy and lactation.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Carbimazole can be safely given during pregnancy and lactation. Carbimazole (first drug of choice) and propylthiouracil (given during pregnancy and lactation ) are the common antithyroid drugs used; 30%–40% of patients remain euthyroid ten years after discontinuation of therapy. However, rarely are relapses corrected with medication.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Large goitres, younger patients, and significantly elevated fT3 and fT4 rarely benefit from medical management. Beta-blockers reduce the adrenergic effects of thyroxine in peripheral tissue. Option: B . A toxic nodule is autonomous and will relapse if medications are stopped. Option: D. Agranulocytosis occurs in only 0.1%–0.5% of patients on antithyroid drugs.

questions.text: Surgery is the preferred treatment option in which of the following cases of thyrotoxicosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Pregnant mothers are not adequately controlled with medications.

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Surgery can offer a cure, reducing the mass of overactive tissue. However, there is a risk of permanent hypothyroidism in total thyroidectomy and recurrence of toxicity in subtotal resections. Repetition can also occur in 5% of cases if less than a total thyroidectomy has been performed. Parathyroid insufficiency occurs in <5% of patients undergoing surgery. The following are indications for surgery: suspicious thyroid nodule by FNAC , pregnant women inadequately controlled on medications, and large thyroid glands with relatively low radioiodine uptake.

Random:

Explanation For All Options:- Options: A, B & C. All 3 require the surgical treatment option in Graves disease.

questions.text: Which of the following is false in neonatal hypothyroidism?

options.label: A
options.text: Endemic cretinism is due to iodine deficiency.

options.label: C
options.text: Biochemical screening for hypothyroidism is carried out on all neonates.

options.label: D
options.text: Radioactive iodine treatment is safe after the first trimester of pregnancy.

questions.correct_answer: D. Radioactive iodine treatment is safe after the first trimester of pregnancy.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Radioactive iodine treatment is safe after the first trimester of pregnancy. It is contraindicated in young children and pregnant and lactating mothers. In hyperthyroid pregnant women, drugs such as propylthiouracil are preferred as they limit the ability to induce hypothyroidism in the fetus.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Cretinism results from inadequate thyroid hormone production during the fetal and early neonatal periods. Endemic cretinism is due to dietary deficiency, whereas sporadic cases are due to an inborn error of thyroid metabolism or complete or partial gland agenesis. Option: B. Macroglossia is a clinical feature. Option: C. Immediate diagnosis and treatment are essential to prevent long-term physical and mental developmental delays.

questions.text: Myxoedema can present as the following:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Myxoedema is associated with accentuated signs and symptoms of hypothyroidism. There is often a malar flush, a yellow tinge to the skin, and an altered mental state. It can present as bradycardia and hypothermia associated with techy- and bradyarrhythmias. Heart failure and infections are associated with increased mortality.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Options: A, B & C. are not correct alone. All three are seen in Myxoedema.

questions.text: Hypothyroidism will NOT be a presenting feature in which of the following conditions?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Benzodiazepine treatment. Benzodiazepines don’t cause hypothyroidism.

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B & D. Hypothyroidism can be classified as the following: goitrous (iodine deficiency, Hashimoto’s thyroiditis, or drugs such as lithium, amiodarone, iodides, and amino-salicylic acid); non-goitrous (atrophic thyroiditis, post-radiation); pituitary-related (panhypopituitarism); neoplastic; infiltrative (sarcoidosis); or infective (rare).

questions.text: A 44-year-old man underwent chemical cardioversion for atrial fibrillation (AF). His baseline TFTs were normal. He is now hypothyroid. Reference values for thyroid function tests (TFTs) are as follows: TSH 0.5 – 4 mIU/L FT3 3.5 – 6.5 pmol/L FT4 10 – 23 pmol/L DIAGNOSIS:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Amiodarone-induced thyroid disease Amiodarone is a popular antiarrhythmic. However, it contains a very high iodine load and can cause overactivation and under-stimulation of the thyroid gland.

Highyeild:

Amiodarone Amiodarone is a class III antiarrhythmic agent that prolongs the action potential duration and refractory period of cardiac cells. It is effective in treating both supraventricular and ventricular arrhythmias, including atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, ventricular tachycardia, and ventricular fibrillation. It has a long half-life and a large distribution volume, which means it can accumulate in various tissues, including the lungs, liver, and skin. This can lead to various adverse effects, including pulmonary toxicity, hepatotoxicity, and It can also cause thyroid dysfunction , including both hypo- and hyperthyroidism . This is due to the high iodine content of the drug, which can interfere with thyroid hormone synthesis and secretion. It interacts with various other drugs, including digoxin, warfarin, and statins . It can prolong the QT interval , increasing the risk of torsades de pointes, a potentially life-threatening arrhythmia. It is contraindicated in patients with severe sinus node dysfunction, second or third-degree atrioventricular block, and those with hypersensitivity to iodine . It should also be used cautiously in patients with severe liver or lung disease.

questions.text: A general practitioner (GP) is having difficulty trying to treat a 62-year-old woman for hypothyroidism. Despite the thyroxine dosage of 200 μg, her thyroid functions suggest hypothyroidism. Reference values for thyroid function tests (TFTs) are as follows: TSH 0.5 – 4 mIU/L FT3 3.5 – 6.5 pmol/L FT4 10 – 23 pmol/L DIAGNOSIS:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

TSH secreting adenomas TSH secreting adenomas is a rare tumor from the anterior pituitary secreting TSH. Despite adequate thyroxine replacement, thyroid hormone resistance is another cause of elevated TSH levels.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Amiodarone is a popular antiarrhythmic. However, it contains a very high iodine load and can cause overactivation and under stimulation of the thyroid gland. Option: B. Thyroid peroxidase antibodies (TPO) are associated with autoimmune hypothyroidism. Option: D. Myxoedema can present with heart block, hypothermia, and sometimes coma.

Extraedge:

In some cases, TSH-secreting adenomas can be part of a larger condition called multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 (MEN1) , an inherited disorder that predisposes individuals to the development of multiple endocrine tumors, including pancreatic and pituitary tumors. Long-term follow-up is recommended for patients with TSH-secreting adenomas, as tumor recurrence or development of other pituitary tumors can occur. Monitoring thyroid function tests and imaging studies are necessary to detect recurrent or new tumors.
